Transcript:
Jack: Well, our old home, Tess. 
We made it back to where it all started.
Tess: Home, Jack?

Jack: Well, maybe not quite 
exactly, but at least it's where we met, huh? I never thought I'd say it, but it 
feels pretty good to be back at this place.
Tess: Why? Why come back here?

Jack: So that me and you can 
focus on us, pretend like there's nothing else out there. Just you and me.
Tess: That's just pretend.

Jack: No, no, no. Tess, Tess, 
hey. Whoa. This is our place.
Tess: No. No, it's not.
Jack: But --

Tess: I don't want to be here 
anymore.

Rafe: Ok. Come on. What's in 
you that allows a bloodsucking vampire to walk around like a normal guy? Come 
on, what's your secret? I find out and I'm one step closer to figuring out 
Stephen Clay's plan, one step closer to nailing that monster to the wall.

Alison: [Disguised voice] Guess 
who.

Rafe: Um -- I don't know. Could 
it be the sexiest, most beautiful girl in all the universe?

Alison: [Normal voice] Not 
quite. You forgot the luckiest. Hi. Wait, wait, wait, wait. Not yet. I have to 
go to my mother's. I would love to, but I can't yet. But look at -- ta-da! I 
brought you the chamber of commerce file on a small business. Jamal gave it to 
us from opening up the bike shop. So now you have a head start on the gym.

Rafe: That's great. Tell him I 
said thanks.

Alison: I will. You could come 
with me if you wanted to.
Rafe: To your mother's?

Alison: Yeah. We're going to go 
discuss wedding stuff. You could --

Rafe: I'm going to leave that 
to the experts. Hey, look, I've got some other stuff to do.
Alison: Other stuff? Like what?
Rafe: Just, you know, stuff.

Alison: "Stuff"? You're being 
so mysterious. Is this about the wedding? Do you have a surprise for me?

Rafe: No, no, you take care of 
the wedding and I'll take care of everything else.

Alison: Everything else? Like 
what?

Rafe: You know, like our 
incredible, happy, wonderful future.

Alison: Oh, ok. Bye. Oh, I am 
the luckiest girl on this planet.

Stephen: Like a ricchianti 
after a feast.
Elizabeth: Looks like blood.

Stephen: Not nearly as sweet, 
but it creates a nice balance. Go ahead and try.

Elizabeth: Mmm. I remember 
everything this time, Stephen. I remember what it's like to bite you. My hunger, 
the warmth, just your veins filling me.

Stephen: Everybody remembers 
their first time, and you always will.

Elizabeth: The whole idea of 
drinking the human blood --

Stephen: Shh. You'll never have 
to feed on anyone. You'll get the urges, but the water will help you control 
that.

Elizabeth: But what if I 
accidentally --

Stephen: You'll never have to 
hurt anyone, Elizabeth. You can live your life exactly the way you want and 
you'll never grow old.
Elizabeth: I'll never age?

Stephen: You'll always be as 
beautiful as you are right now.
Elizabeth: You're serious?
Stephen: Completely.
Elizabeth: I'll be ageless?

Stephen: Forever young, 
sweetheart. All you have to do is keep the water supply safe and never let 
anybody near it.

Livvie: Hey, Ricky, can you do 
me a favor and light the candles out there? The matches are on the table. I'll 
be right out.

Ricky: I got it. No problemo. 
Anything you want as long as I get what I want. Actually, if you ever get out 
here. All right, Livvie, I'm ready for you.
Ricky: My --
Livvie: You like it?
Ricky: What's not to like?

Livvie: I just love an 
appreciative man.
Ricky: Well, it's about time.

Livvie: That's exactly what I 
was thinking. Time to give you a night you've never had.

[Captioning made possible by 
abc, inc.]

Rafe: I figured out what is in 
Stephen's special water. I just have to figure out what it means.

Chris: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You're 
not supposed to be in that lab.

Rafe: Sorry. I was looking for 
Ian.

Chris: Well, Ian isn't working 
on any special research projects right now, so why do you think you'd find him 
there?

Rafe: Just relax, ok? I went 
through the wrong door.
Chris: The wrong locked door.

Rafe: I guess somebody left it 
open.

Chris: No, no one left it open. 
Don't you let me catch you in there again

Rafe: Wait a second. You said 
Ian doesn't do research, but you do.

Chris: Of course I do. I'm the 
best at G.H. Why?

Rafe: Ok, well, it's just that 
I have this list of chemicals here and I have to figure out what it all means 
and --

Chris: And you think I'm going 
to help you because --

Rafe: Because the best 
researcher at G.H. Should be able to help me. That is if you really are --

Chris: Let me see it. Where the 
hell did you get this?
Rafe: You recognize the stuff?
Chris: No, I didn't say that.

Rafe: Come on, you're a bad 
liar, Chris.
Chris: Usually I'm a better ..

Rafe: Somebody's life depends 
on me figuring out what this stuff is.

Chris: This is really close to 
a formula I was working on last year, and I wish I'd never had.
Rafe: What kind of formula?

Chris: It's really none of your 
business.

Rafe: No, Chris -- I'm making 
it my business.

Chris: It's a serum. A vampire 
serum.
[Knock on door]

Alison: Mother, are you in 
there? It's Alison.

Stephen: Alison's timing is 
getting worse and worse.

Elizabeth: What is she doing 
here?
Stephen: Oh --
Alison: Mother?

Stephen: I don't know, but 
she's here.
Stephen: Alison --
Alison: Hi.
Stephen: What a surprise.

Alison: I hope that I'm not 
interrupting anything again.
Stephen: Not at all.

Alison: Thank you. I know I 
should have called and not just, you know, shown up like this, but -- wow, this 
is a really nice place.

Elizabeth: What are you doing 
here, baby?

Alison: I'm sorry, mother. I 
know, you know, just kind of dropping by like this is not ok, but when I went to 
the hotel to go see you, the guy at the front desk said that you had left with 
Stephen and you looked like you weren't feeling very well at all. Are you 
feeling sick again?

Elizabeth: No. I'm -- I'm fine. 
I'm so much better now.

Alison: Well, are you sure? 
Because the guy seemed to think that --

Elizabeth: No, I thought that I 
was having a relapse of that flu, but Stephen brought in his specialist from 
Manhattan and he gave me something and it's just miraculous. It made me feel so 
much better.

Alison: Well, gosh, that must 
have been some medicine to work that fast.
Elizabeth: Something like that.
Alison: Are you sure you're ok?

Elizabeth: Oh, baby, I'm so 
good. I just have never felt quite like this before.

Livvie: Whoa, whoa, hold on. 
Slow down, drummer boy. I like to take it nice and easy.

Ricky: Really? See, I'd have 
never thought that you liked it like that. After all, weren't you pretty hot and 
heavy for me the other night?

Livvie: Yeah. And nothing has 
changed. I just -- I like to savor every moment.
Ricky: Nice and easy?
Livvie: Nice and easy.
Ricky: I think I can do that.

Livvie: This is nice. Hey, 
ricky?
Ricky: Yeah?

Livvie: Could you -- could you 
do me a favor and go get some wine in the kitchen? It's on the counter.
Ricky: Yeah, all right.
Livvie: Thanks.
Ricky: I'll be right back.

Livvie: Don't forget the 
glasses.
Ricky: I won't.

Livvie: Ok. Whew. Now it's time 
for my next little surprise. Ahem.
[Phone rings]

Livvie: Come on, come on, pick 
up the phone.
Stephen: This is Stephen.
Livvie: Hi. It's Olivia.

Stephen: I'm not really in a 
stalking mood right now.

Livvie: Look, don't hang up on 
me. I need to see you tonight.
Stephen: That's impossible.

Livvie: Well, find a way to 
make it possible because I know about your special water, and if you don't give 
me what I want, the next call I make is going to be to your little vampire 
slayer buddy.
Stephen: Don't push it.

Livvie: Then get over here now. 
I'm at my apartment.

Elizabeth: Honey, is everything 
ok?

Stephen: Yeah, I'm fine. You 
ladies are going to have to entertain yourself for a few minutes.

Elizabeth: Stephen, is 
something wrong? Is it something with the band?

Stephen: No. This time it's 
personal. Someone's interfering where they shouldn't.

Elizabeth: You're not going to 
--

Stephen: Hey, nobody's going to 
get hurt.
Elizabeth: I trust you.
Jack: Remember our first kiss?

Tess: I know, Jack. Of course 
it's special here.
Jack: But?

Tess: It's not our home. Not 
anymore. We don't belong.

Jack: But, see, Tess, I feel 
like I belong here so that we can block out the rest of the world and just focus 
on us.
Tess: I'll try, but I'm cold.

Jack: You're cold? Here. Take 
my coat and I am going to build us a fire, just like we used to. I just need a 
few of these logs here. This will be fun. All right, here we go. I'm just going 
to get this fire stoked and you will be warm in no time.
Tess: I like to watch you.

Jack: Well, I like to watch 
you, too. You look so beautiful, especially in light like this.
Tess: Can you hold me?
Jack: Yeah.

Jack: Tess, I will hold you for 
the rest of my life if you'll let me.
Tess: How can you be so sure?

Jack: I just am. Just like I 
was about waiting. But I don't want to wait anymore, Tess. I want to make love 
to you.
Tess: Oh, Jack --
Jack: Sweet, incredible love.
Tess: No. No, no, no, I can't.
Jack: Tess, what is it?

Tess: I can't make love with 
you.

Rafe: A vampire serum? Are you 
sure?

Chris: Well, I'm not positive, 
but you change a few of these ingredients and, yeah, it's really close to the 
thing I was working on.

Rafe: You were working on, 
what, for the good of the world?

Chris: Hey, people were turning 
into vampires. Somebody had to find a cure.

Rafe: Whatever. Just tell me 
what you came up with.

Chris: Well, it was really 
something I stumbled on. It was like a vampire miracle drug.
Rafe: What do you mean?

Chris: It just gave a person 
all the benefits of being a vampire without the need to feed on human blood. 
And, you know, when I tested it, it was --

Rafe: You tested this on 
someone?

Chris: Yeah, but it didn't 
work. I mean, it really didn't work. It was lethal and it almost killed them.
Almost killed them.

Rafe: So, did Caleb learn about 
the research?

Chris: Caleb? Yeah, that's why 
he came after me.
Rafe: So he knew.

Chris: Yeah, he knew. What's 
going on? Where did you get this?
Rafe: Later, Chris.

Chris: Whoa, wait a minute. 
What does this have to do with Caleb? Is he alive?
Livvie: This feels so good.

Ricky: You're a great kisser. 
You know that, Livvie?

Livvie: That's not all I'm good 
at.

Ricky: It's getting kind of hot 
out here on this couch. Why don't we take this into your bedroom.

Livvie: Into the bedroom? I 
didn't think you were so traditional.
Ricky: Oh, I'm not, but --

Livvie: "But --" why don't you 
start to take off your shirt.

Ricky: Whoa, where are you 
going?
Livvie: I'll be right back.
Ricky: All right.

Livvie: Don't worry about it. 
I'm just going to get the glasses and --

Ricky: Whoa. What's up with the 
lights?

Livvie: I want to be able to 
see the look on your face the whole time. What's wrong, Ricky? You've never been 
with a naughty girl before?

Ricky: I like the sound of 
that. Well, why don't you come over here and find out.

Stephen: So this is the game 
you want to play?

Elizabeth: We can get to the 
guest list in a minute. I wanted to ask you something about the cake.
Alison: What about --

Elizabeth: Instead of doing 
four tiers, I think we can go five or six without it getting too ostentatious. 
And you're going to have to decide if you want the butter lace frosting or those 
little marzipan flowers. But in all honesty --
Alison: Mother --

Elizabeth: I think you can do 
both of them. I'm going to make a couple of sketches, so that you can see what 
they look like.
Alison: Mother --

Elizabeth: I haven't even 
decided what I'm going to wear. What do you think? I definitely want to be 
classic and understated but not boring.

Alison: Mother, mother, please. 
Whoa.

Elizabeth: Am I going too fast 
here?

Alison: Yeah. If I didn't know 
any better, I would think that maybe you still had a touch of this, like, weird 
flu thing.

Elizabeth: No, no, no, no. I 
just -- I feel so incredible. Do you want me to tell you my little secret?

Alison: Yeah, I really wish you 
would.

Elizabeth: Alison, it's 
Stephen. This -- he just makes me feel so passionate about him and about love 
and about life and it is just spilling all over into everything. And my greatest 
joy of all is that now I actually get to be your mother and help you with this. 
Alison, I will always be here for you forever, and not just this wedding but for 
the rest of your life.
Alison: Oh, mother.

Elizabeth: I'm going to help 
you find your brother or your sister.

Alison: I know. I know you 
will. I'm so happy for you. I'm happy for you and for Stephen.

Elizabeth: Oh, God, I 
completely forgot. Oh, I had these flowers sent over. Alison, they are so 
beautiful.
Alison: Wait, where --

Elizabeth: I lost my breath 
when I saw them.

Alison: Where are you going 
now?

Elizabeth: I'm just going to 
put them in some water and then I'm going to freshen up a bit and I'll be right 
back. Just make yourself at home.

Alison: Oh, my God. Ok, she has 
all of her energy back. She has more energy than I do. She's making me really 
tired. And thirsty.

Jack: What do you mean, you 
can't make love?

Tess: No. Jack, more than 
anything, I want to be with you, but -- but not here -- at home, to be just 
right.
Jack: But, Tess --

tess: You're scared, Jack. 
You're hiding away here in a cave.

Jack: But this is your home. 
It's a special place.

Tess: No, it's not the same. I 
don't want -- I don't want to be the same anymore.
Jack: But why?

Tess: Because you've taught me 
so much. You've taught me how to love and how to live in the real world. Don't 
you understand?

Jack: Yeah. I was just so afaid 
that I was going to lose you.
Tess: I'll never leave.

Jack: I know. It's just the 
headaches, you know? I mean, you told me that you couldn't heal yourself and it 
just got me a little worried, that's all.
Tess: Please, can we go home?

Jack: We can go home. Let me 
just put this fire out, ok?
[Tess screams]
Livvie: Oh, Ricky, please.

Ricky: Oh, Livvie. You feel so 
good.
Livvie: Yes. Yes.

Stephen: And now it's going to 
feel so very bad.

Rafe: Uh-oh. Your fangs are 
showing, Caleb.
On the next "Port Charles" --
Elizabeth: Give that to me.
Tess: I saw you,Livvie.
Livvie: What?

Tess: You were in the woods and 
you were dead.
Rafe: Ah!
